materials.raw_text: Co: 256 g, Li: 32 g, P: 192 g, Pr: 32 g, Sm: 64 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder): Chemical supply companies; Li (Lithium powder): Battery material suppliers; P (Phosphorus powder): Chemical supply companies; Pr (Praseodymium oxide): Rare earth material suppliers; Sm (Samarium powder): Rare earth material suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder): Chemical supply companies; Li (Lithium powder): Battery material suppliers; P (Phosphorus powder): Chemical supply companies; Pr (Praseodymium oxide): Rare earth material suppliers; Sm (Samarium powder): Rare earth material suppliers.

1. Weigh out 256 g of cobalt powder. 2. Weigh out 32 g of lithium powder. 3. Weigh out 192 g of phosphorus powder. 4. Weigh out 32 g of praseodymium oxide. 5. Weigh out 64 g of samarium powder. 6. In a clean, dry container, combine all weighed powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 256 g of cobalt powder. 2. Weigh out 32 g of lithium powder. 3. Weigh out 192 g of phosphorus powder. 4. Weigh out 32 g of praseodymium oxide. 5. Weigh out 64 g of samarium powder. 6. In a clean, dry container, combine all weighed powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to allow for proper sintering of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to allow for proper sintering of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once the crucible has cooled, carefully remove the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to trim the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealing agent to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once the crucible has cooled, carefully remove the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to trim the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealing agent to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
